title: I hope Lissandra gets a new passive in Mage update
body: It's just very useless late game, I'd say maybe it's a small benefit early game but other than that it does nothing for her

replies.body: As long as it isn't something like "Aspect of the True Ice" that stacks up 500 times. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
"Lissandra stack Aspect of the True ice every 3 basic attack on the same target."

Well, the mana sustain from her passive is about half of what makes her one of the few mages viable in top lane. If you get a new passive, you might end up restricting her to mid. Not that this is an issue for everyone, but something to keep in mind.

As far as passive ideas, maybe a mage version of Ashe. All her abilities have slows attached so there's already a start, all abilities have increased damage on slowed targets and maybe the slow/damage can stack a couple of times.

I disagree. What makes her decent top laner is her "natural" build path with decent amount of health along with her CC and escapes.

This passive has nothing in common with how well she does on TOP.
1 free spell every 18s~~ isn't worth having her mana regen cut in half.
And then because of this 1 free spell her abilities cost a FRIGGIN TON of mana

Spammable Q for 85 mana.........................

except that the passive ticks one second off for every cc'd enemy, including minions. So it's not a free spell every 18 seconds, it's a free spell every 14ish seconds. That's not bad at all. Her passive may not *feel* great, but it actually goes a long way and is absolutely a big part of why she does well top.
Except Lissandra's only AoE CC outside of her ult is W. Which is practically melee.
Not to mention her passive in toplane works way better with W since most toplaners are melee so you end up using it WAY more often, resulting in less cd because melee+minions.

Can't they just put in some kind of mana refund passive on Lissandra similar to Annie and Kalista's Q and E, respectively?

Not enough to break her, and any compensation nerfs if necessary, to add a different passive

That's false as it's taken directly out of her mana pool and regeneration. As it's not a real passive, if she didn't have that passive she'd have more mana and regen equaling out to roughly the same sustain.

I don't think it's interesting design to give a champion spammable spells / high mana costs and then give them a passive that allows them to alleviate it through conservative gameplay.  She's definitely a character that would not only benefit from a new passive, but might actually benefit from a small rework due to how linear her kit is.

The Diana Passive is intentional iirc. If Diana had that 20% bonus from passive and put into her base she would be a monster with Nashor's/Rageblade. The reason these items aren't so good on her now is because her base AS is bad so Riot gave her artifical "higher" AS to make the passive not feel useless.

Orianna's passive on the other hand makes no damn sense since she either out ranges her AA with abilities or doesn't want to deal with the "wind up" of her auto attack animation.

There's nothing really wrong with a linear kit. She has a few simple spells and some mobility and means to sustain her mana which punishes spamming but rewards smarter play. She's a reliable utility mage that can be played as a squishy, diving assassin, a more traditional mid liner who helps peel and assist, or a bulky aura carrier who relies on her utility to see her team to victory. The simplicity is the best part of her kit.

Yes but that doesn't stop it from being the blood of your abilities. Without mana most champions are no more then body shields. It might not seem like it's making an impact but when you can cast your ultimate free of costs despite fighting in a prolonged battle there isn't much else to be said.

If you count the amount of mana she uses to her abilities, to the cooldowns of them and her passive Lissandra basically gets a free mana pot with each usage of her passive. Early, Mid or Late game that's a good thing.

On top of that not every passive has to be useful at all stages of the game. Trading late game destruction for unrivaled early game power is a fair trade.
